thread.title: Tickets available for Whole Backstage's 'Black Tie Broadway'
thread.title_full: Tickets available for Whole Backstage's 'Black Tie Broadway'

author: William Thornton | wthornton@al.com
title: Tickets available for Whole Backstage's 'Black Tie Broadway'
text:
Tickets available for Whole Backstage's 'Black Tie Broadway' whole backstage.PNG Comments 
The Whole Backstage's production of "Black Tie Broadway" opens Oct. 9 at the Whole Backstage Theatre in Guntersville. 
The musical review will have a two-week run. It features about 90 songs from over 50 musicals performed by a cast of more than 70 performers. 
Performances are scheduled for Oct. 9, 10 15, 16 and 17 at 7 p.m. and Oct. 11 and 18 at 2 p.m. at the theatre, 1120 Rayburn Ave. in Guntersville. Tickets are $18 for adults and $16 for students and senior citizens and are now on sale at www.wholebackstage.com or by calling (256) 582-7469. 
Director Johnny Brewer said he has been working on assembling the show since February and the cast features performers who have been involved in productions since the sixties. 
"We surveyed the cast and crew members and found they had participated in over 700 shows just with the Whole Backstage as well as experience in productions with other groups as well," Brewer said. 
The production includes songs that were audience favorites from "Oklahoma!," "Godspell," and "The Sound of Music," as well as selections from "Wicked" and "Les Miserables." There will also be a "Young Performers" section and a "Broadway Disney" section, with songs from "Mary Poppins," "Beauty and the Beast," and "Aladdin."
